title: Petitions express sadness and anger over decision to sack Ranieri | Leicester Mercury
text:
Petitions express sadness and anger over decision to sack Ranieri By Tom_Mack | Posted: February 26, 2017 1 COMMENTS SHARES Petitions express sadness and anger over decision to sack Ranieri X 
Copy link to paste in your message / 
The sacking of Claudio Ranieri has prompted two new petitions on the Government's website Change.org. 
Adham Fisher has started one to pressure the owners into taking Ranieri back. 
The petition states: "As fans of Leicester City Football Club, football in general, Leicester and Leicestershire, we feel it is horrible that the club have sacked their manager, Claudio Ranieri, nine months after he guided them to the Premier League title and wrote perhaps the greatest ever sporting story. 
"Mr Ranieri asked the players to stay for one more year after the title win, to see what else could be achieved. It is very disappointing that the club has not afforded him the same courtesy." Read More: Interim boss Craig Shakespeare insists there is no player revolt 
As of 11am on Saturday, 14 people had signed the petition. 
Among the fans signing was Liz Yeates, who wrote: "We can stop making stupid mistakes and it is important that we do. Have brexit and Trump not taught us anything about decision making?" 
Click here to sign Adham's petition. 
Another fan, Scott Johnson, has started a Change.org petition to thank Ranieri for leading Leicester to glory. 
The petition, which had 52 supporters within 24 hours of starting, states: "After the sacking of Claudio Ranieri, we the fans would like to show our everlasting appreciation for bringing the Premier League title to the club in 2016. 
"An unbelievable achievement which should be recognised and immortalised." 
Among those signing it was Kerry Evans, who commented: "I am now 53 years old and have been a season ticket holder since I was six years old. This man gave me my dream. Simply a legend." 
Adrian Macleod added: "Disgraceful from the owners, the bloke is a legend."
